intro: Pimpinella yangtzensis, commonly known as Yangtze pimpinella, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
